channel.title: Beginners on Lotus Docs Example Site
channel.description: Recent content in Beginners on Lotus Docs Example Site

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to Our Technical Documentation Project linkThis project is part of our Informatics Engineering course. It gives you practical help to build and manage websites for technical documentation. We use modern web technologies and follow industry best practices to help you learn technical documentation well. What We Aim to Do linkWe are here to help both new and seasoned developers understand how to create documentation websites. Our project includes everything from managing content and designing, to following accessibility standards and working with backend technologies.

item.title: About Page Implementation
item.description: Introduction linkIn this page it is possible to follow a step by step guide that aims to educate the reader on how to make the color picker page in this website. Set up link Install Hugo and Go If you haven’t installed Hugo and Go, you can go see the installation guidelines provided in Hugo Installation. If you do already have them installed you can skip this step and go directly to the next one.

item.title: Color Picker Page implementation
item.description: Introduction linkIn this page it is possible to follow a step by step guide that aims to educate the reader on how to make a the olor picker page in this website. Set up link Install Hugo and Go If you haven’t installed Hugo and Go, you can go see the installation guidelines provided in Hugo Installation. If you do already have them installed you can skip this step and go directly to the next one.

item.title: Color Picking
item.description: Customizing the Top Header with Color Pickers linkWe’ve introduced an interactive feature to the top header of our site, allowing users to personalize their experience by changing the background and font colors. This guide will walk you through the changes made to top-header.html to add this functionality. Introduction linkThe top header of our website now includes two color pickers: one for the background color and another for the font color.

item.title: Deployment
item.description: Requirements git Go ≥ v1.19 Hugo ≥ v0.100.0 (Extended Version) Install Hugo Install the Hugo CLI, using the specific instructions for your operating system below: Linux Homebrew (macOS) Windows (Chocolatey) Windows (Scoop) Your Linux distro’s package manager may include Hugo. If this is the case, install it directly using your distro’s package manager – for instance, in Ubuntu, run the following command. This will install the extended edition of Hugo:
